metadata.title: CVE-2015-8366 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
Array index error in smal_decode_segment function in LibRaw before 0.17.1allows context-dependent attackers to cause memory errors and possiblyexecute arbitrary code via vectors related to indexes.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8366` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.18.2-1
libraw20 - 0.18.2-1
No subscription required

dcraw - 9.28-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libraw package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.18.2-1').
darktable package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
exactimage package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
dcraw package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.28-2').
rawtherapee package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
kodi package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
